climbs.name: Whip
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description: Moves may be difficult - pro is more than adequate.
content.protection:
1/2" bolts.

Single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: route goes up the left side of the white face, just to the right of Reeling in the Years.

climbs.name: Swangin'
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description: Climb up the ramp/rib on the south side of Gateway Rock. Well protected and fun at 5.5.
content.protection: 1/2: bolts with sport anchors at the top. Shares anchors with Reeling in the Years & Whip.  Single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: Route climbs up the ramp on the south side of Gateway Rock. Route starts at the southern foot of the ramp.

climbs.name: Sharp Dressed Man
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney, Chris Barnes, Mike Engle; April, 2018

content.description: Start at a bulge just off the ground and make a move up a left onto a steep slab.  Pass a short overlap and stay right of the deep, dark gash.  Continue up on steep climbing with small holds to a couple hand jams under a small bulge.  Move left around and over the bulge to easier terrain with a pair of cracks.  Follow the cracks to a flat shoulder and clip the anchors.
content.protection:
12 bolts, sport anchors, about 65 feet.

Single rope to descend.
content.location: After about 5 mins of walking up the steep approach trail the first crag encountered is Gateway Rock.  The climbs start at the switch back in the trail at the base of the crag (which is also the first switchback on the approach trail).

climbs.name: Reeling in the Years
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description: Climb up pulling a mantle/lie-back - upward on interesting holds - buckets of water and chert finishing on the right side of the south ramp.
content.protection:
1/2" bolts

Single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: First route right of Swinging (south rib)

climbs.name: Momma Told Me Not to Come
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney; April 29, 2018

content.description: Work up a slab to a bulge just left of a deep, dark gash.  Pull over the bulge and face climb up steepening terrain to finger crack.  A hard move gains the finger crack.  A few tip jams with bad feet lead to the anchors.
content.protection:
13 bolts, sport anchors, about 75 feet.

Single rope to descend.
content.location: After about 5 mins of walking up the steep approach trail the first crag encountered is Gateway Rock.  The climbs start at the switch back in the trail at the base of the crag (which is also the first switchback on the approach trail).

climbs.name: Grateful Deadpoint
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney, May 2018;  FFA:  Kira Engle & Mike Engle, June 12, 2018

content.description: Moves are very sequential and fluid, enjoy.
content.protection:
1/2" bolts

Single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: Climb up the brown streak just right of Whip.

climbs.name: The Boys are Back in Town
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney; May 2018

content.description: Climbing is thin, protection is excellent
content.protection:
1/2" bolts

Single 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: Route goes up the face right of Grateful Deadpoint, moving left of the large cavity on the upper face
